text: Dean Ford (born Thomas McAleese; 5 September 1946 â€“ 31 December 2018) was a Scottish singer-songwriter. He was born in Coatbridge, North Lanarkshire, Scotland. He was best known for his role as lead vocalist and frontman of the beat pop group Marmalade from 1966 to 1974. He co-wrote the group's worldwide hit "Reflections of My Life". Ford died on 31 December 2018 in Los Angeles, California, at the age of 72.
